title: The Near-Future of Regulatory Submissions: Embracing Reproducibility, Open Source, and Interactivity
The Near-Future of Regulatory Submissions: Embracing Reproducibility, Open Source, and Interactivity
text:
Is this course for me?
If your answer to any of the following questions is ‚Äúyes‚Äù, then this is the right workshop for you.

Do you make adverse event tables or descriptive statistics tables in R? Or table shells for either?

The workshop is designed for those with some experience in R. It will be assumed that participants can perform basic data manipulation. Experience with the {tidyverse} and the %>% operator is a plus, but not required.

title: The Near-Future of Regulatory Submissions: Embracing Reproducibility, Open Source, and Interactivity
text:
Prework
THIS WILL BE ON POSIT CLOUD Before attending the workshop please have the following installed and configured on your machine.

Recent version of R
Recent version of RStudio
Most recent release of xxx and other packages used in workshop.
# install isntructions
Ensure you can knit R markdown documents

Open RStudio and create a new Rmarkdown document
Save the document and check you are able to knit it.
